required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Sulfasalazine in Treating Painful Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Randomized, Double-blind Clinical Study to Evaluate the Effect of Sulfasalazine on Painful Neuropathy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that sulfasalazine, an FDA-approved medication for rheumatoid arthritis and ulcerative colitis, may be beneficial in neuropathic pain conditions. In this study, the investigators will evaluate whether sulfasalazine improves pain due to painful peripheral neuropathy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: second week of two week treatment period
primary_outcome.description: Average pain score will be the average of daily pain scores (0-10) recorded by the subject in a pain diary during the second week of the two week treatment period. Higher scores are worse (0=no pain, 10=pain as bad as you can imagine).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Average pain score will be the average of daily pain scores (0-10) recorded by the subject in a pain diary during the second week of the two week treatment period. Higher scores are worse (0=no pain, 10=pain as bad as you can imagine).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With >=50% Pain Reduction (First Treatment Period)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: second week of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Average pain score will be the average of daily pain scores (0-10) recorded by the subject in a pain diary at baseline and during the second week of the two week treatment period. Higher scores are worse (0=no pain, 10=pain as bad as you can imagine). Percent pain reduction will be calculated from BL to end of treatment period 1 (2 weeks), based on average pain scores at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With >=50% Pain Reduction (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Average pain score will be the average of daily pain scores (0-10) recorded by the subject in a pain diary during baseline and the second week of each of the two week treatment periods. Higher scores are worse (0=no pain, 10=pain as bad as you can imagine). Percent pain reduction will be calculated from BL to end of treatment period 1 (2 weeks) and from end of treatment period 1 to end of treatment period 2 (2 weeks), based on average pain scores at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Functioning Score Assessed Using the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) Interference Scale (First Treatment Period Only)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The BPI interference items are general activity, mood, walking ability, normal work (including housework), relations with other people, sleep, and enjoyment of life. The seven items are rated from 0 (pain does not interfere) to 10 (pain completely interferes).

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Functioning Score Assessed Using the Euroquality of Life (EQ-5D) Metrics (First Treatment Period Only)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D physical functioning items are mobility self-care, and usual activities. These three items are rated from 1 (no problems) to 5 (unable).

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Functioning Score Assessed Using the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) Interference Scale (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The BPI interference items are general activity, mood, walking ability, normal work (including housework), relations with other people, sleep, and enjoyment of life. The seven items are rated from 0 (pain does not interfere) to 10 (pain completely interferes).

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Functioning Score Assessed Using the Euroquality of Life (EQ-5D) (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D physical functioning items are mobility self-care, and usual activities. These three items are rated from 1 (no problems) to 5 (unable).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) total score. The BDI has 21 items, each scored 0-3. Higher values are worse. The total score is the sum of the 21 items and ranges from 0-63.

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotional Functioning (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) total score. The BDI has 21 items, each scored 0-3. Higher values are worse. The total score is the sum of the 21 items and ranges from 0-63.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Will be assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) reflects a patient's belief about the efficacy of treatment. Item 1 is as follows: Since beginning treatment at this clinic, how would you describe the change (if any) in ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS, SYMPTOMS, EMOTIONS, and OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE, related to your painful condition? (tick ONE box) (1=No change (or condition has gotten worse), 2=Almost the same, hardly any change at all, 3=A little better, but no noticeable change, 4=Somewhat better, but the change has not made any real difference, 5=Moderately better, and a slight but noticeable change, 6=Better, and a definite improvement that has made a real and worthwhile difference, 7=A great deal better, and a considerable improvement that has made all the difference). Item 2 is as follows: In a similar way, please circle the number below that matches your degree of change since beginning care at this clinic (0-10 scale): 0= Much better, 5= No change, 10= Much worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Improvement (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Will be assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) reflects a patient's belief about the efficacy of treatment. Item 1 is as follows: Since beginning treatment at this clinic, how would you describe the change (if any) in ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS, SYMPTOMS, EMOTIONS, and OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE, related to your painful condition? (tick ONE box) (1=No change (or condition has gotten worse), 2=Almost the same, hardly any change at all, 3=A little better, but no noticeable change, 4=Somewhat better, but the change has not made any real difference, 5=Moderately better, and a slight but noticeable change, 6=Better, and a definite improvement that has made a real and worthwhile difference, 7=A great deal better, and a considerable improvement that has made all the difference). Item 2 is as follows: In a similar way, please circle the number below that matches your degree of change since beginning care at this clinic (0-10 scale): 0= Much better, 5= No change, 10= Much worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Categorical Rating of Pain Intensity (First Treatment Period Only)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using number of days rated as none, mild, moderate, or severe in pain diary

secondary_outcome.measure: Categorical Rating of Pain Intensity (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using number of days rated as none, mild, moderate, or severe in pain diary

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed during two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days breakthrough pain medication was taken

secondary_outcome.measure: Breakthrough Treatment (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed during two week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days breakthrough pain medication was taken

secondary_outcome.measure: Missed Medication Dose (First Treatment Period Only)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed during two week treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Missed Medication Doses (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed during two week treatment period

arm_group.description: 1 g oral twice daily for 2 weeks
oral placebo pill twice daily for two weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Painful neuropathy
- Michigan Neuropathy Screening Instrument score of 3 or greater
- no obvious alternative explanation for neuropathy
- average baseline pain > 4/10
Exclusion Criteria:
- other severe pain
- anticipated difficulty weaning off medications
- past or current psychiatric disorder as determined by Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview
- medical contraindication to sulfasalazine
- not proficient in English (due to heavy use of questionaires)
- pregnant or breast feeding women

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Sulfasalazine Then Placebo
group.description: Sulfasalazine (1 g oral twice daily) for two weeks, washout period of one week, placebo for 2 week period

group.title: Placebo Then Sulfasalazine
group.description: Oral placebo pill twice daily for two weeks, washout period of one week, sulfasalazine for 2 week period

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Participants who were randomized to either Group A or Group B: Group A: Placebo daily for two weeks, washout period of one week, sulfasalazine for 2 week period Group B: Sulfasalazine daily for two weeks, washout period of one week, placebo for 2 week period.

outcome.title: Pain Score (First Treatment Period)
outcome.description: Average pain score will be the average of daily pain scores (0-10) recorded by the subject in a pain diary during the second week of the two week treatment period. Higher scores are worse (0=no pain, 10=pain as bad as you can imagine).
outcome.time_frame: second week of two week treatment period

group.description: 1 g oral twice daily for 2 weeks Sulfasalazine

group.title: Placebo
group.description: oral placebo pill twice daily for two weeks. placebo

measure.title: Pain Score (First Treatment Period)
measure.description: Average pain score will be the average of daily pain scores (0-10) recorded by the subject in a pain diary during the second week of the two week treatment period. Higher scores are worse (0=no pain, 10=pain as bad as you can imagine).

outcome.title: Pain Score (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
outcome.description: Average pain score will be the average of daily pain scores (0-10) recorded by the subject in a pain diary during the second week of the two week treatment period. Higher scores are worse (0=no pain, 10=pain as bad as you can imagine).
outcome.time_frame: Assessed at end of two week treatment period
outcome.population: 8 participants were randomized, but 2 participants did not complete the second period of the study. So 6 participants received both sulfasalazine and placebo treatments, one only received sulfasalazine in period 1, and one only received placebo in period 1.

outcome.title: Overall Improvement (First Treatment Period Only)
outcome.description: The Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) reflects a patient's belief about the efficacy of treatment. Item 1 is as follows: Since beginning treatment at this clinic, how would you describe the change (if any) in ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS, SYMPTOMS, EMOTIONS, and OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE, related to your painful condition? (tick ONE box) (1=No change (or condition has gotten worse), 2=Almost the same, hardly any change at all, 3=A little better, but no noticeable change, 4=Somewhat better, but the change has not made any real difference, 5=Moderately better, and a slight but noticeable change, 6=Better, and a definite improvement that has made a real and worthwhile difference, 7=A great deal better, and a considerable improvement that has made all the difference). Item 2 is as follows: In a similar way, please circle the number below that matches your degree of change since beginning care at this clinic (0-10 scale): 0= Much better, 5= No change, 10= Much worse.
outcome.time_frame: Will be assessed at end of two week treatment period
outcome.population: 2 participants in the sulfasalazine group are missing PGIC information.

outcome.title: Missed Medication Doses (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
outcome.time_frame: Assessed during two week treatment period
outcome.population: 8 participants were randomized, but 2 participants did not complete the second period of the study. So 6 participants received both sulfasalazine and placebo treatments, one only received sulfasalazine in period 1, and one only received placebo in period 1.

group.title: Sulfasalazine
group.description: 1 g oral twice daily for 2 weeks Sulfasalazine

group.title: Placebo
group.description: oral placebo pill twice daily for two weeks. placebo

measure.title: Missed Medication Doses (Using the Crossover Comparison Structure of the Study)
measure.population: 8 participants were randomized, but 2 participants did not complete the second period of the study. So 6 participants received both sulfasalazine and placebo treatments, one only received sulfasalazine in period 1, and one only received placebo in period 1.

reported_events.time_frame: Two study periods that were each two weeks in length.

group.title: Sulfasalazine
group.description: 1 g oral twice daily for 2 weeks Sulfasalazine

group.title: Placebo
group.description: oral placebo pill twice daily for two weeks. placebo

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
